The only way to fix this is to change `startup_mode: Windowed` to `startup_mode: Maximized`, but after trying to resize the maximized window, it gets very small again.
What size are you setting it to? Can you share your config?

The problem occurs even if the config file is not configured. With the default settings.
But okay, here's my config (I removed all commented lines.):

issue.title: Window size wrong on kwin_wayland

labels.name: DS - wayland
labels.description: Affects the Wayland backend, or generally free Unix platforms

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body:
When running `alacritty` on `kwin_wayland 5.23.3` in windowed mode only a small window is shown.

Tested on `kwin_wayland` versions:
- 5.22.5 -> working
- 5.23.3 -> size is wrong

Issue in `alacritty`: https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/5603

body:
We're being fed garbage in, in the full log downstream (https://bugs.kde.org/show_bug.cgi?id=445444) we have:

[3085624.976]  -> xdg_wm_base@18.get_xdg_surface(new id xdg_surface@21, wl_surface@17)
[3085624.986]  -> xdg_surface@21.get_toplevel(new id xdg_toplevel@22)
**[3085624.990]  -> wl_surface@17.commit()**
[3085624.994]  -> xdg_toplevel@22.set_min_size(2, 1)
[3085624.999]  -> xdg_surface@21.set_window_geometry(0, 0, 1340, 1042)
[3085625.006]  -> wl_compositor@4.create_surface(new id wl_surface@23)
[3085625.010]  -> wl_seat@7.get_pointer(new id wl_pointer@24)
[3085625.018]  -> zxdg_decoration_manager_v1@5.get_toplevel_decoration(new id zxdg_toplevel_decoration_v1@25, xdg_toplevel@22)
[3085625.024]  -> zxdg_toplevel_decoration_v1@25.unset_mode()
[3085625.027]  -> xdg_toplevel@22.set_min_size(2, 1)
[3085625.031]  -> xdg_toplevel@22.set_max_size(0, 0)
[3085625.035]  -> xdg_toplevel@22.set_app_id("Alacritty")
[3085625.038]  -> xdg_toplevel@22.set_min_size(2, 1)
[3085625.041]  -> xdg_toplevel@22.set_max_size(0, 0)
[3085625.047]  -> xdg_toplevel@22.set_title("Alacritty")

That wl_surface,commit should be after the initial properties and deco creation. Otherwise kwin has nothing to go on for the first configure.

> [3085624.999] -> xdg_surface@21.set_window_geometry(0, 0, 1340, 1042)

Also, note that calling `xdg_surface.set_window_geometry` before the first surface commit is wrong as there's no attached buffer!

Thanks for the details @davidedmundson. This specific issue has a workaround patch upstream already and while none of the behavior shown here is against the Wayland protocol specification afaik, upstream is looking into adapting behaviors more similar to other clients.

No, it's not, but if an app sends the initial properties after the initial commit, some compositor features may not work as expected. For example, since the app id is unknown when the initial state is committed, some window rules (a feature in kwin) may not work with alacritty, etc. Same goes to the min size, the compositor may choose not to send the first configure event with size of 0x0, in which case knowing the min size hint might be useful.
Note that you also don't need to call unset_mode() after creating the xdg-toplevel decoration. The compositor will use its preferred decoration mode.

The desired initialization sequence would look as follows

* create an xdg-surface
* create the xdg-toplevel
* create the xdg-toplevel-decoration object
* set app id, size hints, preferred decoration mode (if any), etc
* wl_surface_commit()

For the record, ozone has similar issue https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1268308

issue.title: Wrong window size on kwin_wayland (upstream, fixed, depency update needed)

repository.name: neovide
repository.description: No Nonsense Neovim Client in Rust

issue.body:
<!--- NOTE: PLEASE FILL OUT TEMPLATE RATHER THAN DELETING --->

**Describe the bug**

Initial size of neovide's window is wrong on `kwin_wayland` (KDE's wayland compositor).

It seems to be the same issue Alacritty had: https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/5603

I had the very same issue with alacritty, which got fixed by compiling from this PR: https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/5650

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Use KDE wayland desktop session
2. Start neovide
3. Window doesn't show (wrong initial size)
4. (optional/workaround) Since it's impossible to see and therefore resize the window with the mouse, using any resizing keyboard shortcut can force a resize and the window is visible, making it visible. In my case I use shortcuts to tile window to up/down/left/right of the screen, which I can use to place the window to any screen side and then move/resize the window manually

**Expected behavior**

A visible, working, window from the start.

**Screenshots**

Initial window (the pixels inside the red circle):

![20211204-135530](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4762/144717799-ad3d84c3-1f6e-4abf-b6a6-0009d8a64c40.png)

Task switcher (alt-tab) showing neovide's window and kitty terminal:

![20211204-135347](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4762/144717828-140e734c-f42e-4bec-b6f1-4c044d77177e.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

 - OS: Fedora Linux 35 (KDE Plasma) x86_64
 - Neovide Version: master
 - Neovim Version: v0.5.1

**Please run `neovide --log` and paste the contents of the `.log` file here:**

[neovide_rCURRENT.log](https://github.com/neovide/neovide/files/7654292/neovide_rCURRENT.log)

**Additional context**

The issue seems to be with wayland context initialization upstream (glutin or winit, not sure) and seems to be fixed in glutin 0.28.0 / winit 0.26.0.
